39909.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"29nfj","text":"Set up the required number of Qubit tubes for standards and samples. The Qubit dsDNA assays require two standards for calibration. 39909.section: Qubit Working Solution and Sample preparation
39909.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8hdnv","text":"Add 190 μl of working solution to each of the standard tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39909.section: Qubit Working Solution and Sample preparation
39909.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2v0qk","text":"Add 10 μl of each standard to the appropriate tube, then mix by vortexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39909.section: Qubit Working Solution and Sample preparation
39909.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2j039","text":"Add 198 μl of working solution to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39909.section: Qubit Working Solution and Sample preparation
39909.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fr982","text":"Add 2 μl of each sample to the appropriate tube, then mix by vortexing. The final volume should be 200 μl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39909.section: Qubit Working Solution and Sample preparation
39909.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7g6jq","text":"Allow all tubes to incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9d0cc","text":"Plan for sufficient time to allow complete thawing of the cartridge. 39998.section: Preparing the Reagent Cartridge for the MiSeq
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f1nk","text":"Once thawed, invert the reagent cartridge 10 times to mix, and then visually inspect to verify that all reagents are completely thawed and free of participates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Preparing the Reagent Cartridge for the MiSeq
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvk4k","text":"Gently tap the cartridge on the bench to dislodge air bubbles in the bottom of the wells, and wipe the cartridge off with a paper towel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Preparing the Reagent Cartridge for the MiSeq
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"28a88","text":"Place the thawed reagent cartridge and HT1 on ice or at 2-8oC until the sample is ready to be loaded. (The cartridge contains photosensitive reagents and should be kept in the dark)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":59,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Setting up the run on the MiSeq
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"13da8","text":"Prior to setting up the run, ensure that there is enough free disk space (100GB) on the instrument. If there is less than 100GB available, proceed to Instrument Mainentance section to free up disk space.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":150,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Setting up the run on the MiSeq
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"34j5e","text":"From the MCS home screen, select Sequence","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Setting up the run on the MiSeq
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ifof","text":"Select a run option:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ne83","text":"    • Local Run Manager: Select this option if the run has previously been set up in the LRM Software","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ap4g2","text":"    • Sample Sheet: Select this option if a sample sheet has been generated for the run. The sample sheet will be sent         to the LRM for validation and","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5nveq","text":"automatic run creation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4i2rv","text":"    • Manual: Create a run manually but selecting all parameters of the run. No secondary analysis will be performed if this option is selected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Setting up the run on the MiSeq
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"98nrr","text":"Enter BaseSpace email and password if applicable (Note: DM does not use BaseSpace). Select Next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Setting up the run on the MiSeq
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"asglp","text":"Select the Local Run Manager run or select the sample sheet for the run depending on the option used in Step 10.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Setting up the run on the MiSeq
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"q1rp","text":"Proceed immediately to Preparing and Loading the Flow Cell section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":23,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m8ns","text":"The flow cell and Incorporation buffer (PR2) are located in Box 2 of 2 and stored at 2-8oC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":88,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97sum","text":"While wearing clean, powder-free gloves, carefully remove the flow cell from the container, by gripping the base of the plastic end.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbglh","text":"Lightly rinse the flow cell with molecular-grade water, making sure to rinse both sides of the glass and plastic casing. It is very critical to ensure all excess salts are removed. If salts dry in the imaging area, imaging can be affected during the run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9merk","text":"Pat dry the flow cell using a lint-free wipe, using care around the black port gasket.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vutg","text":"Wet a clean piece of lens paper with ethanol and clean the glass portion of the flowcell. The glass must be free of streaks, lint, and tissue fibers. An alcohol wipe can also be used for this step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ei98u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"362nt","text":"Do not add ethanol directly to the flow cell, and avoid getting ethanol on the port gasket.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":91}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"atpet","text":"Dry any excess ethanol with the lens paper and visually inspect to make sure that the flow cell is free of smudges or debris and dry. Inspect the port gasket to ensure it is well-seated around the flow cell ports. If the gasket appears to be dislodged, gently press it back into place until it sits securely around the flow cell ports.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tff2","text":"Raise the flow cell compartment door and gently press the release button to open the clamp and remove the previously used flow cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4elg5","text":"Holding the flow cell by the edges, place it on the flow cell stage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qo3u","text":"Gently press down on the flow cell clamp to close it over the flow cell (it will click when closed fully). Close the compartment door. The software should identify the flow cell RFID.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"buj20","text":"Select Next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3e4i","text":"Gently invert the bottle of PR2 to mix, and then remove the lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4nm4n","text":"Open the reagent compartment door.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"39q05","text":"Raise the sipper handle until it locks into place.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5m7c3","text":"Remove the wash bottle and load the PR2 bottle. Re-cap the wash bottle and set aside for future use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e71td","text":"Empty the contents of the waste bottle into the appropriate chemical waste container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46sc4","text":"Lower the sipper handle, make sure the sipper lowers into the PR2 and waste bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8tmvu","text":"The software will identify the RFID of the PR2 bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1dbhs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dklc7","text":"Note: If the RFID is not read by the system for any step, the software prompts you through the steps to obtain a temporary bypass code and proceed with setting up the run. For more information, see “Resolving RFID Read Failure” in the MiSeq System User Guide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4fnrs","text":"Select Next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"352pa","text":"Remove the thawed reagent cartridge, ensuring that it has been thoroughly dried and the reagents have been mixed by inversion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2g8o0","text":"Tap the reagent cartridge on a hard surface to collect contents at the bottom of the reservoirs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"30c7k","text":"Use a clean 1000 μl pipette tip to pierce the foil seal over the reservoir labeled Load Sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":83,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"95qc6","text":"Transfer   of the denatured DNA library into the Load Sample reservoir, take care to avoid droplets on the foil seal as sample is being transferred.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":49,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1p3ah","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"600","guid":"21185D70D5A011EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"70hni","text":"Check the bottom of the cartridge to ensure there are no bubbles present at the bottom of the reservoirs. If so, tap the cartridge gently on the tabletop to release the bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8rcse","text":"Make sure the MCS screen states Load Reagent Cartridge to ensure the sippers in the chiller have been raised.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4lir2","text":"Open the reagent chiller door, remove the wash tray, and dry bottom of chiller compartment if necessary. (Humidity fluctuations in the laboratory can cause condensation to pool in the chiller)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6s81p","text":"Hold the reagent cartridge by the end with the Illumina label and slide it into the chiller until it stops.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"74mhf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fg001","text":"Note: Do not leave the chiller door open for extended periods of time","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7kjis","text":"Close the chiller door and check the screen to confirm the software has identified the RFID of the reagent cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cop7f","text":"Close the reagent compartment door.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"391k7","text":"Select Next. Review run parameters and ensure that they are correct. Select Next to start the Pre-Run Check.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":76,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f6cb6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3peig","text":"Note: The system performs a check of all run components, disk space, and network connections prior to a run start. If any part of the pre-run check fails, a message will appear with general instructions describing the error and details","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9229e","text":"how to correct it. For more information, see “Resolving Run Setup Errors” in the MiSeq System User Guide. If all items successfully pass the pre-run check, the system is ready to start the run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

39998.section: Loading the Sample into the Cartridge and Loading into the Instrument
39998.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6lhip","text":"Select Start Run. Once the run has started, do not open the instrument or touch the instrument monitor unless to pause or stop the run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eaj29","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4qptt","text":"Note: The MiSeq is sensitive to vibration, performing tasks that cause vibration during a run could cause the run to fail or adversely impact sequencing results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4n0fc","text":"Post-Run washes are required at the conclusion of every run. It is recommended by FDA-GenomeTrakr to also perform a post-run wash (Tween only) at the beginning of each run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vvbf","text":"Once the run is complete, select Start Wash option at the bottom of the MCS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5jcv","text":"Check the box for Perform optional template line wash to proceed with a Postrun bleach wash. The purpose of the bleach wash is to reduce the rate of carryover of nucleic acids to proceeding runs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"de762","text":"Prepare fresh wash solution with Tween-20 and laboratory grade water:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"n10r","text":"Prepare a fresh dilution of molecular-grade sodium hypochlorite (NaOCl – Bleach), using molecular-grade water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a9kt5","text":"Insert the MiSeq wash tube with the 0.01% NaOCl solution into position 17 of the wash tray until the neck of the tube is flush with the tray. The tube must be put into position 17 only. Inserting the tube in other positions can cause cluster generation failure and can damage the fluidic system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":180,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etgfs","text":"Add at least   of the 0.5% Tween-20 Wash solution in to all other reservoirs of the wash tray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"critv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"6","guid":"1177E5F0D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dr611","text":"Add   of 0.5% Tween-20 Wash solution to the 500 ml wash bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3gb96","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"350","guid":"31275160D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjgrc","text":"Open the reagent compartment door and reagent chiller door, and remove the used reagent cartridge from the chiller.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1k09","text":"Slide the wash tray into the chiller until it stops, then close the chiller door.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"40a22","text":"Raise the sipper handle fully and remove the used PR2 bottle and replace with the wash bottle. Discard the residual buffer in chemical waste and the used PR2 bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bo57","text":"Remove waste bottle and discard of the contents in a chemical waste receptacle that is appropriate for formamide. Return the waste bottle to the reagent compartment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cv5i5","text":"Lower the sipper handle and close the reagent compartment door.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4leon","text":"Select Next","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8c4nr","text":"Once the post-run bleach wash is complete, select Done on the screen to return to the MiSeq Control Software home screen. Leave the used flow cell, wash tray, and wash bottle on the instrument. The sippers will remain in the down position, they should remain in the wash solution to prevent drying out and air from entering the fluidics. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"87i2j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"966ol","text":"OPTIONAL: A second-post run wash can be performed with Tween-20 wash solution only to clear out any excess NaOCl from the lines.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3cqd4","text":"10 % Tween-20: Add   of Tween-20 to  of molecular grade water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ci05o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","guid":"28CDDDE0D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"45","guid":"2ADD35E0D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65fqt","text":"0.5% Tween-20 Wash: Add   of 10% Tween-20 to   of molecular","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":45,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c2ln4","text":"grade water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"25","guid":"2344A160D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"475","guid":"257B0960D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8scd6","text":"Invert five times to mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnq2k","text":"Preparing stock solutions of 10% and 0.5% tween are not advised, these stocks can grow mold and become contaminated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fd4vj","text":"0.2% NaOCl: Add   of 5% NaOCl to   of molecular-grade water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f303t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"36","guid":"1E39BCA0D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"864","guid":"20347B30D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22ajg","text":"0.01% NaOCl: Add   of the 0.2% NaOCl to   of molecular-grade water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":17,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"31b69","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"50","guid":"16A17640D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"950","guid":"18D26000D5A211EA87BEFB8C8214978F","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97te","text":"Add the entire 1.0mL of the 0.01% NaOCl to the wash tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"27cv0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c5afk","text":"Note: Using the correct concentration of NaOCl is important. If the concentration is too high, it can cause cluster generation failures in subsequent runs. It is recommended to purchase the NaOCl from Sigma as listed in the reagents section. Use of Clorox is not advised due to the variability in concentration of NaOCl. Template line washes should not be performed with maintenance or standby washes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"94dau","text":"Maintenance during Normal Operation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"643m0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"l5kqs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"auru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"B8FC2F7F344911EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":148,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/public/ba1dd1d494bd692629514d6c78b05926a031bc64cf16027befb6ac0956bd48f9/cggj9zjn.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/public/ba1dd1d494bd692629514d6c78b05926a031bc64cf16027befb6ac0956bd48f9/cggj9zjn.png","type":1,"width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ntrn","text":"Maintenance during Idle Operation: (Instrument unused for \u003e14 days):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"49v8b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ddcjt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8rivj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"B9037981344911EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":127,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/public/ba1dd1d494bd692629514d6c78b05926a031bc64cf16027befb6ac0956bd48f9/cggm9zjn.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/public/ba1dd1d494bd692629514d6c78b05926a031bc64cf16027befb6ac0956bd48f9/cggm9zjn.png","type":1,"width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"750qu","text":"Perform a Post-Run Wash (without bleach):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"71qh9","text":"It is a good practice to run a Post-Run wash prior to starting a run to ensure that the fluidic lines are flushed and there are no air bubbles that could affect the run. A post-run wash should also be performed once a week if the instrument is sitting idle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6t37","text":"If the instrument is not to be used for an extended period of time (\u003e14 days), the instrument should be prepared for idle mode by performing a standby wash. {"blocks":[{"key":"dsqqn","text":"The standby wash consists of two 60 minutes washes with the 0.5% Tween-20 wash solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8aav9","text":"After the initial standby wash, a standby wash needs to be performed every 30 days while the instrument remains idle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7mbuk","text":"PhiX is a balanced genome of a bacteriophage and recommended by Illumina as an internal control to assess how well the sequencing instrument is performing. {"blocks":[{"key":"cqv32","text":" The MicroRunQC output file includes the following columns:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7la1u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s62b","text":"Parameter Input Description Contigs Assembly Number of contigs in the de-novo SKESA assembly. Contigs smaller than 200 base-pairs (bp) are not counted.  Length Assembly Total length of all contigs \u003e 200bp. This should approximate the size of the genome for the target organism. EstCov Assembly Mean coverage for contigs in the SKESA assembly. N50 Assembly Sequence length of the shortest contig at 50% of the total genome length MedianInsert Read Distance between forward and reverse reads. Calculated by mapping reads to SKESA assembly using bwa. MeanLength_R1 Read Mean length of forward read MeanLength_R2 Read Mean length of reverse read MeanQ_R1 Read Mean Q-score of forward read MeanQ_R2 Read Mean Q-score of reverse read Scheme Assembly PubMLST (pubmlst.org) database scheme (e.g. senterica for Salmonella enterica) ST Assembly Sequence Type  Loci Assembly gene (allele number) – for example aroC(118) {"blocks":[{"key":"d9n5h","text":"Create a new BioProject  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bku5n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ptn6","text":"BioProjects are an organizing tool at NCBI that pulls together different kinds of data submitted across multiple NCBI databases. Each BioProject has a unique URL, providing a home page with a title, description, links to lab websites, publications, and funding resources associated with a particular project, along with links to the deposited data. A basic data BioProject holds actual sequence data, assemblies, and their associated metadata. An umbrella BioProject is a way to group two or more data BioProjects together, which is useful for coordinating disease surveillance and for looking across the grouped BioProjects in a single view.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":357,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":447,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ihno","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ee12q","text":"This portion of the protocol describes the steps for creating a new data BioProject linked to an existing umbrella BioProject (usually established by a coordinating group, e.g. GenomeTrakr, NARMS, Vet-LIRN). {"blocks":[{"key":"44ia9","text":"BioSample:  Metadata associate to the isolate might require the creation of new fields in BioNumerics. The term 'field content ' denotes that the template value e.g. Organism name is mapping to the field in BioNumerics e.g. OrganismName.  The template values might map to default values e.g. Pathogen: environmental/food/other; version 1.0.    Make sure to include the metadata associated to the isolates in the mandatory fields such as:  Submitter Provided Unique ID, BioSample accession (output), Organism name, Title, Attribute package, Strain name, Isolate name alias and Project name.   Isolate name alias is a mandatory field for GenomeTrakr submissions.  Provide serovar when available. NCBI","Field Name in
BioNumerics Submission Metadata Template","Description"],["BioProject accession","BioProject","NCBI bioproject","The accession number of the BioProject(s) to which the BioSample belongs (PRJNAxxxxxx).  **Double check that you are submitting to the correct BioProject (the organism name must match the one designated for your BioProject). For species that fall outside of NCBI pathogen detection, we recommend establishing a separate multi-species "research" bioproject for publishing data outside of the structured Pathogen Detection surveillance effort."],["Attribute package","attribute_package","attribute_package","This field provides the pathogen type (or “isolation type”). Allowed values are
  “Pathogen.cl” (for human clinical pathogens) or “Pathogen.env” (for
  environmental, food, or animal clinical isolates). The value provided in this
  field drives validation of other fields and cannot be left blank."],["Strain name","strain","Key","This
  is the authoritative ID used for foodborne pathogen genomic epidemiology and
  within NCBI Pathogen Detection. Although the strain ID can have any format,
  we suggest that it be unique, concise, and consistent within your laboratory
  (e.g. CFSAN123456). "],["Serovar","serovar","Serovar","The
  organism serovar/serotype name should include the most descriptive
  information you have at time of submission, adhering to proper nomenclature
  in NCBI taxonomy database:
  https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Browser/wwwtax.cgi. Check spelling
  carefully!"],["Isolate name
  alias","isolate name alias","isolate_name_alias","Other
  IDs associated with this isolate. Separate with ';' if more than one"],["Project name","project name","ProjectName","Name
  of the project within which the sequencing was organized"],["Collected by","collected by","collected by","Full
  name of laboratory or agency that collected the sample or has taken over
  curation of the physical isolate. The name should be written out in
  full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions.  Example: Washington State Department of
  Health."],["Collection /
  Isolate date","collection date","IsolateDate","Date
  on which the sample was collected. Populate using ISO 8601 standard:
  “YYYY-mm-dd”, “YYYY-mm” or “YYYY” (e.g., 1990–10–30, 1990–10, or 1990).  Including the month or month/day of
  collection is extremely valuable for accessing seasonality in the database."],["Geographical
  origin","geographic location","SourceCountryState","Populate
  the geographic origin of the food product. Include the country name if
  imported, or the "Country: state/territory/province" if domestic.
  Include multiple locations if necessary, delimited by semi colon."],["Geographical
  coordinates","latitute and
  longitude","lat_long","The
  geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected.
  Specify as degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S
  d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 38.98 N 77.11 W. 
  If information is unavailable for any mandatory field, please enter
  'not collected',  'not applicable' or
  'missing' as appropriate."],["Isolation
  source","isolation source","isolation source","Free
  text, short description of sample source. Avoid generic terms such as
  patient, sample, food, surface, clinical, product, source, or
  environment.  Example: bagged romaine
  lettuce."],["Host","host","host","For
  human, animal, and plant hosts, include the full taxonomic name of the host
  when available, "Homo sapiens" or "Bos Taurus". Animal
  livestock terms are also acceptable entries, e.g. porcine, bovine, equine,
  etc."],["Host disease","host disease","host_disease","Name
  of relevant disease, e.g. Salmonella gastroenteritis. Choose an ontological
  term from https://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/DOID or
  https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh. 
  Attribute is mandatory for Pathogen.cl isolates (human clinical
  isolates) or include "missing" if unkown. Leave blank if not
  relevant."],["Sequenced by","sequenced by","SequencedBy","The
  name of the agency that generated the sequence, e.g., Centers for Disease
  Control and Prevention"],["Source name/
  type","source type","SourceType","Controlled
  vocabulary describing the isolation_source. Choose the best fit term: Human,
  Animal, Food, Environmental, Other."],["Organism
  name","Organism","organism","The
  organism name should include the most descriptive information you have at
  time of submission, adhering to proper nomenclature in NCBI taxonomy
  database: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Browser/wwwtax.cgi. Check
  spelling carefully! Levels of valid organism names are as follows:
    Genus species:
    Salmonella enterica
    Listeria monocytogenes
    Genus species and subspecies:
    Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica
    Determined serotype or serovar (trad or
  WGS-based):
    Escherichia coli O104:H7
    Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Agnoa
    Salmonella enterica subsp. diarizonae serovar 16:z10:e,n,x,z15
    Listeria monocytogenes serotype 1/2a
    If NCBI doesn’t have the desired organism name, enter the name determined
  by your laboratory. After submission, a “taxonomy consult” will take place to
  evaluate the new name. Sometimes the organism name is changed to a canonical
  serovar name and the submission proceeds. It is also possible that the
  serovar is a novel one not currently in the NCBI database and the Taxonomy
  team will work with the submitter to get the new name added to the database."]],"guid":"4231A30950694B8089FE368C0907AC7A","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":44,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2c3tc","text":"Table 1: Metadata attributes for GenomeTrakr","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Field Name at BioNumerics NCBI Submission Prompt","Field Name at
